metadata.title: CVE-2021-27922 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Pillow before 8.1.1 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memoryconsumption) because the reported size of a contained image is not properlychecked for an ICNS container, and thus an attempted memory allocation canbe very large.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-27922` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-pil - 8.1.2-1
python3-pil.imagetk - 8.1.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pillow package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.1.2-1').
